name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: The novel explores the irrationality of adult attitudes towards race and class in the Deep South of the 1930s through the innocent viewpoint of a young girl.

author: George Orwell
summary: Set in a dystopian future where critical thought is suppressed under a totalitarian regime, the novel follows the story of Winston Smith as he rebels against the oppressive government.

name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: The novel depicts the roaring twenties in America, focusing on the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his pursuit of the elusive Daisy Buchanan.

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: The first book in the Harry Potter series follows the young wizard Harry as he discovers his magical heritage and battles the dark wizard Voldemort.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A classic romantic novel set in rural England, it follows the life of Elizabeth Bennet as she navigates love, marriage, and social expectations.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: The novel follows the cynical teenager Holden Caulfield as he navigates the challenges of adolescence and searches for meaning in a superficial world.

name: To the Lighthouse
author: Virginia Woolf
summary: A pioneering work of modernist literature, the novel explores themes of time, memory, and the complexity of human relationships.

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: A fantasy adventure novel, it follows the hobbit Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on a quest to reclaim a treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

name: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: A high fantasy epic, it follows the journey of the hobbit Frodo Baggins as he seeks to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron.

name: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: Set in a futuristic society where individuality is suppressed, the novel explores themes of technology, social control, and the pursuit of happiness.
